poem:
"An Echo Lost in Careless Arms"

In the quiet nursery, a small flame extinguished,
wrapped in linen, cradled in hollow canvas.
Genevieve, little-crowned darling - silenced.
Her protestations bounced off walls, returned unheard, useless.
A cruelty, veiled beneath the hands of innocence,
suffocates the tender bud - thus blooms negligence.
Stricken cries, ignored; yet, in each heart, rings unending,
In memory of Gigi, and a life too swiftly ending.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Baby died after being left face-down at Stockport nursery, court hears A nursery deputy manager caused the death of a baby she placed face-down, tightly swaddled and strapped to a bean bag for more than 90 minutes, a court has heard. The resulting distressed cries of nine-month-old Genevieve Meehan, known to her family as Gigi, were “simply ignored”, the jury was told on Tuesday. Kate Roughley, 37, is accused of the manslaughter by ill treatment". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
